moves.1. e4:
Accepted challenge from eesther  not aware that this player was undefeated. Thanks for the game!
At the end of this game, that clean sweep was stopped. Red fox is Rising and shows why in our game.
I am not going to try to explain move by move as I have done in most of my past annotations. Please do this for me. This annotation was made by me to promote this game we all play. eesther has told me to annotate our game and will also add comments. on with the game white opens e4.
moves.2. Nf3 c4: ? I'm not sure what happened here, pawn is pushed and is hanging! Crazy like a fox I guess, If game continued this way it would of ended quickly.
moves.3... Qc7: Well this is interesting, why not? Let's move my Queen early. I'm sure this will get the LSB to either move or get protected, The f7 pawn is in attack.
moves.4... a6: I'm playing like a new chess player,
moves.6. Nc3: both of his N's are now developed.
moves.6... b5: Maybe this pawn push was planned with support from my wing pawn on a6?
moves.7. Bb3: LSB retreats still targeted on the white diagonal keeping a eye on my K
moves.7... e6: this pawn is now played exposing my DSB with a nice view of the black diagonal towards the side of the board.
moves.8. a3: pawn goes up 1  was a4 better? It does stop my N going to b4 or pinning with my DSB
moves.8... Bb7: This is where my  LSB is finally developed on the main diagonal looking at the many pieces.
moves.9... Na5: N goes to the rim for now attacking the LSB
moves.12... Nc4: N moved to a better position
moves.13... Be7: DSB completes my development ahead of white.
moves.15. b3: pawn attacks my well placed N
moves.16... Qxe5: I take back with my Q
moves.20... Nd5: N moves from the attacking pawn
moves.21. Ne4: N is well placed to the center of the board
moves.25... g6: pawn defends pawn from LSB and R attack of h file.
moves.26... Nxf4: N takes P attacks Q it also protects P on g6
moves.30... Re2#: Re2# discovered check mate wins the game.   id=eesther first rated loss on GK  This was my first undefeated player win. My closest game was a draw against another undefeated player. This game was very close and decided by one move
